Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of foreparts of two trace horses (only muzzles and chests remaining) of quadriga, to right; at their heads, facing left, part of draped female (himation decorated with added white dot rosettes, added red bands and border of zigzags between two bands of white dots; hand not painted white) and part of warrior (round shield with device of two white dolphins; thigh and top of red greave).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.18)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 281-2, no. B245)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0154) (Phase 1)
